result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin F LaLonde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs on each count.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To pay restitution in the amount of $4,363.94 plus any statutorily authorized surcharges. To pay restitution in an amount yet to be determined plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with the Best Western Motel.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must submit a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin within 10 days. Probation can terminate after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from probation agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 3.   80 days stayed, to be used at Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. Sentence can be served in Brown or Shawano counties. Defendant is responsible for notifying the Door County Jail if sentence is being served in a county other than Door County.  Huber release granted. 60 days to report.
To perform 40 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with the Best Western Maritime Inn.
To pay restitution in full plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision apply to both counts.

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Minute sheet. Defense waives reading of the Information. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court dismisses Cts. 2 & 4 but reads in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must submit a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin through the Door County Sheriff Dept. and pay the $250 DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make statement on sentencing.  Bond is no longer in effect.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Benjamin F LaLonde in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant Benjamin F LaLonde in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
